text: Edward Albert "Ed" Feigenbaum (born January 20, 1936) is an American computer scientist. His works focuses in the field of artificial intelligence. He is a joint winner of the 1994 ACM Turing Award.David Alan Grier. (Oct.-Dec. 2013). "Edward Feigenbaum [interview]." Annals of the History of Computing. p. 74-81. He is often called the "father of expert systems." ==References== Category:1936 births Category:Living people Category:American computer scientists Category:Scientists from New Jersey
title: Edward Feigenbaum
